intro: Draba asprella, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia, thriving in alpine and subalpine habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–20 cm, featuring basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is adapted to cold, rocky environments. Draba asprella is often found in meadows, scree slopes, and rocky areas where it contributes to alpine biodiversity.
